Waste management practices and antimicrobial resistance development
Q1. Solid wastes originating from household that contain drugs left over are disposed openly to the environment
Q2. Manure and other wastes from pigs and poultry are used directly by farmers along the basin
Q3. Treated wastes from waste water treatment ponds are disposed off into the environment
Q4. There is agricultural activities that use manure obtained from animal farming in this area
Q5. House hold slurry is directly released to the river and other water source
Q6. There is leakage of surface water pipes that provide entrance and mixing of manure and other wastes to the water
Q7. Manure and other wastes from the animals farmed are directly thrown into the river and other water sources
Q8. River water is directly used for irrigation/agriculture activities in this area

Q9. River water is directly used by animal that are farmed in this area
Q10. There are fish caught along this area and its nearby tributaries
